Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Potassium channel toxin alpha-KTx 1.1 (ChTX-Lq1; charybdotoxin; Arthropods, animals)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Structure Description: These structures show that charybdotoxin is composed of a beta-sheet linked to an alpha-helix by two disulphide bridges and to an extended fragment by the third disulphide bridge.
Sequence Information.Function: Potent selective inhibitor of high conductance (maxi-K), different medium and small conductance calcium-activated potassium channels (KCa/KCNM), as well as a voltage-dependent potassium channel (Kv1.3/KCNA3). It appears to block channel activity by a simple bimolecular inhibition process.
Sequence Information.Domain: Has the structural arrangement of an alpha-helix connected to a beta-sheet by disulfide bonds (CSalpha/beta).

Literature.Title: Multidimensional signatures in antimicrobial peptides.
Literature.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2004 May 11;101(19)7363-7368.
Literature.Author: Yount NY, Yeaman MR.

Literature.Title: Three-dimensional structure of natural charybdotoxin in aqueous solution by 1H-NMR. Charybdotoxin possesses a structural motif found in other scorpion toxins.
Literature.Author: Bontems F, Roumestand C, Boyot P, Gilquin B, Doljansky Y, Menez A, Toma F.

Literature.Title: NMR solution structure of a two-disulfide derivative of charybdotoxin structural evidence for conservation of scorpion toxin alpha/beta motif and its hydrophobic side chain packing.
Literature.Author: Song J, Gilquin B, Jamin N, Drakopoulou E, Guenneugues M, Dauplais M, Vita C, Ménez A.

Literature.Title: Analysis of side-chain organization on a refined model of charybdotoxin structural and functional i
Literature.Author: Bontems F, Gilquin B, Roumestand C, Ménez A, Toma F.
